noBundle.description: Skip Wrangler’s build steps and show a preview of the script without modification. Particularly useful when using custom builds.

compatibilityDate.description: A date in the form yyyy-mm-dd, which will be used to determine which version of the Workers runtime is used.

compatibilityFlags.description: Flags to use for compatibility checks.

latest.description: Use the latest version of the Workers runtime.

ip.description: IP address to listen on, defaults to localhost.

inspectorPort.description: Port for devtools to connect to.

host.description: Host to forward requests to, defaults to the zone of the project.

localProtocol.description: Protocol to listen to requests on.

localUpstream.description: Host to act as origin in local mode, defaults to dev.host or route.

assets.description: Root folder of static assets to be served. Unlike --site, --assets does not require a Worker script to serve your assets.

site.description: Root folder of static assets for Workers Sites.

siteInclude.description: Array of .gitignore-style patterns that match file or directory names from the sites directory. Only matched items will be uploaded.

siteExclude.description: Array of .gitignore-style patterns that match file or directory names from the sites directory. Matched items will not be uploaded.

upstreamProtocol.description: Protocol to forward requests to host on.

var.description: Array of key:value pairs to inject as variables into your code. The value will always be passed as a string to your Worker.

define.description: Array of key:value pairs to replace global identifiers in your code.

tsconfig.description: Path to a custom tsconfig.json file.

persistTo.description: Specify directory to use for local persistence.

remote.description: Develop against remote resources and data stored on Cloudflare’s network.

testScheduled.description: Exposes a /__scheduled fetch route which will trigger a scheduled event (cron trigger) for testing during development.
